intro: Phanera ornata subsp. mizoramensis, commonly known as the Mizoram phanera, is a flowering plant native to the northeastern regions of India. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
